events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car on a busy intersection, resulting in significant front-end damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a customer's car and the nature of reported collision damage.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim and oversee the process from investigation through settlement.
The claim was acknowledged promptly, and the insured was informed about the next steps regarding document submission and assessment.
Requested police reports, vehicle registration papers, photographs of the damages, and witness statements to support the claim investigation.
The insured submitted all requested documents including detailed photos of the damaged vehicle and a copy of the police collision report.
Claims investigation team began evaluating the accident details, inspecting submitted documents, and contacting involved parties for clarifications.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of fault assessment and damage valuation supporting the claim eligibility for settlement.
A settlement offer was proposed based on repair cost estimates and policy coverage, communicated clearly to the customer for review.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed appreciation for the timely and transparent communication.
Claim was formally approved confirming the agreed settlement amount and repair provisions under the auto insurance policy.
Payment for the approved claim amount was processed and disbursed to the customerâ€™s designated bank account.
The auto accident claim case was officially closed following successful payment and confirmation of vehicle repairs completion.
All documentation and case files related to the auto accident claim have been archived in the company system for future reference.
